creator: iheino+l4j.ack5789@cc.hut.fi
text:
There seems to be no documentation on what the multiline message support 
considers multiline. A file with 50000 log messages loaded fine before the 
yesterday's changes, today it shows only first couple messages.Some of the log 
messages were interpreted as part of throwable too. Maybe it's trying to fit 
50000+ lines in a single throwable and not showing the message before it thinks 
it has reached the end?

Can you provide a small example log file and describe the patternlayout you're
using?
creator: sdeboy@iname.com
iheino+l4j.ack5789@cc.hut.fi
text:
Created attachment 12699
pattern: TIMESTAMP LEVEL(FILE:LINE)#CLASS,LOGGER THREAD!MESSAGE

creator: iheino+l4j.ack5789@cc.hut.fi
text:
And timestamp format yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS. Chainsaw only displays log line number 13.
Yes, that file does not even include multiline logs - I'm suspecting that
there may be more than one problem so let's solve simplest one first...

Yes, I know that log pattern is ugly.
And no, it isn't meant for human consumption as is :-)

Thanks for submitting.  

I've committed a number of changes to address the issue(s).

There were a few problems, one relating to the escape of # symbols in the
pattern (now that we're using ORO for matching).  I also changed the receiver so
that empty text matches succeed (in your file, the "(:)" sections).

The Web Start version may not be updated until early next week so if you'd like
to try it, please pull from CVS.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com
